Start/stop/delete services
[Platform abstraction]


Typedefs

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Start_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Stop_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
typedef IPDR_BOOL(* IPDR_IsRunning_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Delete_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_SetExporterHandle_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_ExporterHandle CH)
typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_UnsetExporterHandle_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P)

Detailed Description

The start/stop/delete services are used to create and destroy the platform abstraction. The error message routines are here also

Typedef Documentation

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Delete_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
 

Free any resources internally allocated by the platform abstraction layer and stop execution of any code started (if any) by the Start operation.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_BOOL(* IPDR_IsRunning_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
 

Test whether the transmitter (client) is running.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
0 for not running, 1 for running.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_SetExporterHandle_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_ExporterHandle CH)
 

Set the transmitter (client) handle in the platform abstraction (so that logging can be done from the platform abstraction).

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
CH The transmitter (client) handle as returned by IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Start_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
 

The Start function is called by the library from within the IPDR_StartExporter function. After successfully calling this function, the library proceeds to use event services. The implementation of the Start function may for example enter a loop containing a 'select' statement, which monitors a set of file descriptors and implements timers using the timeout parameter of 'select'. If system has an external select loop, the Start function should be empty.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Stop_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
 

Stop any tasks / threads used for providing the timer / socket event services. After calling Stop, the transmitter (client) assumes that these services are not active but the abstraction layer can still be used.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_UnsetExporterHandle_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P)
 

Called by IPDR_DeleteExporter() to unset the transmitter (client) handle in the platform abstraction.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
